title: What Champions Should I Buy?
body: Hi all im not sure who i should buy , i have 7900 ip and im choosing between kindred and tahm kench , i dont play a particular role im just looking for a fun to play and strong champion , and i heard kindred is strong and could quite possibly get nerfed next patch

replies.body:
Everyone shouts nerf whenever a champion comes out, and they pretty much always do yes BUT not always hard. People are saying that kindred is too strong, that she's OP etc but let's be honest the word OP is overused. I think she will get a small nerf yes, but not a huge one, as people learn to play against her she won't be nearly as strong. That said she will still be strong in blind pick because her strongest counters are specifically knockbacks (to knock her out of her W) which are harder to come by than most types of cc.

With that said, my personal pick would be Kindred, but I never enjoyed the tank playstyle much. Tahm is very strong, his scaling health damage post 6 is huge and he has great cc and peel potential. his pitfall is in the reliability of that cc. If you're versing a kite-y or cc heavy team you'll have a hard time getting the three stacks to stun or devour.

Both Kindred and Tahm are very versatile champs so their both solid picks. I personally prefer Kindred's mobility though. It's very responsive, she one of those champions that's VERY satisfying to play well and is easy to play but challenging to play well (my favourite kind of champ). 

Tahm can play top/jng/supp and Kindred can play jng/adc so they're both multi role champs...that's all I got. Enjoy whoever you end up picking!

I think Kindred is really fun - Cruising through the Jungle her play seems really smooth and she feels really responsive to play.

But Tahm Kench can be really rewarding to play so I honestly think he's a bigger game changer than Kindred will ever be but I play a lot of Marksmen so to me having one in the Jungle was a big plus :P

Personally, I've only played kindred once, which was on OFA... But if I was too choose, here are some aspects from the two...

Tahm kench if you like...
Tanky damage dealers
Fun trolling 
Good poke 
Never dying 
Being hated (only if you troll) or being loved (if you eat your ally and save them...)
The supp role...

Kindred if you like...
If you wanna take the time to learn this champ
To be a OP asshole (deals so much damage late game!)
Fun marksman 
The jgler role 
Jumping around and kiting your enemy's 
Ults that make you invincible... 

I own tahm kench, and am waiting for kindred to drop to 6300 ip next week to buy her, so it's up too you...
